text: Proverbs of Solomon
The proverbs of Solomon:
A wise child makes a father glad,
but a foolish child grieves his mother.
Treasures of wickedness do not profit,
but righteousness delivers from death.
Yahweh will not cause a righteous person\f + \fr 10:3 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* to go hungry,
but the craving of the wicked he will thwart.
A slack hand causes poverty,
but the hand of the diligent enriches.
He who gathers in the summer \add is\add* a child who is prudent;
he who sleeps at the harvest \add is\add* a child who brings shame.
Blessings \add belong\add* to the head of the righteous,
but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
The memory of righteousness \add is\add* like a blessing,
but the name of the wicked will rot.
A heart of wisdom will heed commandments,
but a babbling fool will come to ruin.
Whoever walks in integrity\f + \fr 10:9 \ft Hebrew “in the integrity” \f* will walk securely,
but whoever follows perversity, his ways will be made known.
The winking of an eye causes\f + \fr 10:10 \ft Or “gives, sets up” \f* trouble,
and the foolishness of lips comes to ruin.
A fountain of life \add is\add* a mouth of righteousness,
and a mouth of wickedness conceals violence.
Hatred stirs up strife,
but love covers over all offenses.
On the lips of one who has understanding, wisdom is found,
but a rod \add is\add* for the back of one who lacks ⸤sense⸥.\f + \fr 10:13 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
Those who are wise lay up knowledge,
but \add to\add* the mouth of the fool, ruin draws near.
The wealth of the rich \add is\add* the city of his strength;
the ruin of the poor \add is\add* their poverty.
The wage of the righteous \add leads\add* to life;
the gain of the wicked to sin.
\add On\add* the path to life is he who guards instruction,
but he who rejects rebuke goes astray.
He who conceals hatred \add has\add* lips of deceit,
and he who utters slander—he is a fool.
In many words, transgression is not lacking,
but he who restrains his lips is prudent.
Choice silver is a tongue of righteousness,
a heart\f + \fr 10:20 \ft Or “mind” \f* of wickedness is ⸤of little worth⸥.\f + \fr 10:20 \ft Literally “like a little” \f*
Lips of righteousness feed many,
but fools ⸤die for lack of sense⸥.\f + \fr 10:21 \ft Literally “in the lack of heart, they die” \f*
The blessing of Yahweh makes \add one\add* rich,
and he does not increase sorrow with it.
\add It is\add* like a sport for a fool to do wrong,
wisdom for a person of understanding.
The dread of the wicked will come upon him,
but the desire of the righteous will be granted.
With the passing of the tempest, there is no wickedness,
but \add the\add* righteous have a foundation forever.
Like vinegar to the tooth and like smoke to the eyes,
thus \add is\add* the lazy to one who employs\f + \fr 10:26 \ft Or “sends” \f* him.
The fear of Yahweh adds life,
but the years of the wicked are shortened.
The hope of the righteous \add is\add* gladness,
but the expectation of the wicked comes to nothing.
A stronghold for the upright is the way of Yahweh,
but ruin \add belongs\add* to ⸤evildoers⸥.\f + \fr 10:29 \ft Literally “them who do evil” \f*
The righteous one is forever; he will not be removed.
But the wicked will not remain in the land.\f + \fr 10:30 \ft Or “earth” \f*
The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom,
but a tongue of perversity will be cut off.
The lips of the righteous know \add the\add* acceptable,
but the mouth of the wicked, the perverse.
